wow. this is probably the longest moodswing/i hate people phase i've been through in a long time. i'll be spending a lot of time by myself this week, all of next week and the week after. i want to go skiing the first weekend in february but my finances may not allow. at the same time i just am not feeling being around people. school was okay. i had kindy kids. they are always lovely. but they just made me think about my niece and my sister who i miss. my godbaby who will be 1 year old March 18th and I still haven't planned what I'll do for her yet. i just feel this planning thing. i have to plan what i'm doing this weekend and all the weekends until school is out. i want to plan bb's bday shindig. i want to plan what i'm going to do after i have to leave JET (since i have decided to stay another year). i need a plan for every fuckin' thing and that's getting on my nerves. i need a new friend. i said it tonight to BB as a joke, but i think i do. he's always tired and i'll wanna talk and i can hear in his voice that he is ready to go or that there's something else he wants to do. which is fine because he works hard and deserves his evening time, but i guess that's how it is once you get comfortable with someone. they don't have to try so hard to be interested. not that he is disinterested, but not so much as he was. i need something new.

my friend said yesterday that she thinks the song by Vivian Green "Emotional Roller Coaster" was written for her. I think it was though. for her and every other woman/man that is able to feel. sometimes we think its a bad thing to be unstable emotionally, but i don't think it is. i think what's bad is not being able to control it once you feel like it starts to get out of hand. i don't have to be happy all the time. i don't HAVE to have it together all the time. i don't HAVE to smile all the time. i don't HAVE to be a people person all the time. i just know that when i'm having the "I can't stand people" minutes, hours, days that i need to be by myself and not subject others to my moods. why was in the post office today and some strange guy who i don't know comes up to me and asks me how much money i make? here's a reinactment of our convo best i can remember: Asshole: You've got a big salary don't you? (it was a dude who lives in my village but you don't go around asking folks about their salary! even folks you know and I didn't know this dude from a can of paint) ME: I get paid. I'm not sure if its what you'd call a lot or not but i get paid. Asshole: Yeah, i know you do get paid. What? Like 300,000yen a month?" ME: How much do you get paid? Do you talk about your salary with strangers? Asshole: No..not really ME: Then WHY are you asking me about mine? I get paid. I'm not telling you anything else. Goodbye. ASS: stands there looking like the freak he is with his mouth open as I walk out

where are interesting folks when you want someone to chat to? why am i sitting here thinking "why don't i ever know exactly what i want but i know exactly what i don't want"? why aren't there any English programs on TV tonight until 10:10pm? why must i be forced to watch movies i've seen a million times already because there's shit on tv? why are people "renting" their children to smuggle crack internationally? why did i get an email from RR today and almost cry when i know i don't want him in my life anymore and am glad that i've moved on? why do i call someone i don't really want to hear from just for the confirmation that i really don't want to hear from them? "you're weird" says BB on IM. and he's right. I am weird. Sometimes I puzzle myself. Had another "selfish/weird" E moment. I was reading emails from an old friend of mine. Back during the time while we were "courting" so to speak and I really wanted to hear his voice. So, I called him at home. Missed him. Left a message. Then I called him at work. No friend. Left yet another message. Only this time I said some crappy Love Jones bull like "I'll call you again another time, and I'm going to keep calling until the next is the right time." Well then I went to bed and woke up to and email from him. Lots of unimportant filler then the "I'm going out of town this weekend with (drumroll....) my girlfriend." And then the sealant "I just smiled because my first thought was, 'Damn, Eboni sounds like a grown-ass woman' ". At the end of it all, we do end up chatting on IM for a minute when he tells me that this girlfriend of his is "THE ONE". He's my boy. I don't like him like that. I should be hella happy for his old ass finally finding someone who was ready when he was....but that's not how I feel. I'm not HATING but I can't put my finger on this emotion. Then it hits me. I don't want him, but I want him to want me. I don't intend to pursue him because he doesn't want me but I think I feel a little empty in some way because he doesn't want me. Is that wrong? Is that selfish? HELL YES. But let me feel like Tony Rich cause nobody knows it but me. I'm not dying inside, don't get me wrong. But there is a little strange feeling there.

Okay, since my last message things have gotten much much better. My travel partner met up with me a few days later and now we're back in Singapore. Malaysia is a very very Muslim country and Kuala Lumpur the capital city has the largest population by far of practicing Muslims so getting their groove on isn't the highest on their priority list. So, what you have is a big ass city with lots of potential for fun and trouble but sad to say...its a bust. During the day you've got plenty of shit to do. Walking around viewing mosques, museums, cultural shows etc, but when its time to go out...it leaves much to be desired. The alcohol is very expensive and when you go to the clubs they have this weird thing where you get 30 mins of DJ 30 mins of a live band ALL NITE. who the hell wants to hear Malaysian Hootie and the Blowfish/Santan Wannabees all night long? NOT THE KID! So...I'm anxiously awaiting returning to Tokyo and being with my peeps. I'll enjoy the day life here and hang around the Inn Crowd (my backpacker which is PHAT by the way..www.the-inncrowd.com) and drink with the other packers at bars in the area. Hittin' the manmade beach this morning and a few rounds of mini golf (which is about all the golf i can manage) and maybe seafood for dinner. E

i had quite a rough experience last night. when i got to the airport in singapore it was about 1am. i did got my bags and went out of the customs area like a dummy instead of staying in the travelers area where the couches were. see the plan was to find a comfy place to crash until the AM when I'd venture into town and find a train up to Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. So, I couldn't find anything comfy anywhere and read as long as my eyes would stand it then tried to lay down on this hard 4 seat row. slept for a whole 30mins then decided i'd need a plan B! so i hung around up there til 4ish and read more in my lonely planet guide book that the first train up to KL is at 642 so i took a cab to the train station at that time. come to find out the schedule from the book was way way way old and the station doesn't even OPEN until 7am. plus between the hours of midnight and 6am the cabbies charge 50% MORE than usual. so here i am at the closed train station at 4:30am (by my watch) which is really 3:30am here. so i go in an open outside coffee shop (it was sooo humid this morning) get a snack and and sleep til 6:45. at this time I still don't know the first train isnt til 915am. i need a shower. i'm hot and havent slept well, they open up and break the bad news to me. so i ask them to watch my backpack and i take a walk out in the city to find breakfast and calm my nerves. that was nice. great looking city too. i'm looking forward to finishing my trip up there, even though yeah i know, i'm just getting started. i got back in time for the train took my seat and headed up to KL. Didn't arrive in the station until 3:30 and am just settling into my room here at Pondok now at 5pm. I'm going to repack my things, shower and go get some grub and maybe find some mischief! I deserve it!!! I also just got an email from my traveling companion Takeyah and she is stuck up in Bankok and wont be down here til tomorrow night so i have the rest of the night and all day tomorrow to piddle around alone and find fun. YEAH!!! Traveling alone is different, but cool. I'm sure the adventure is just beginning.

Jumpers Yesterday as my train home from Tokyo was pulling into Hachioji Station, we hit a suicidal jumper. I was in the first car pulling in so it was MY car that hit her. This was a 5 o'clock limited express train that travels one of the busiest routes in Tokyo. From what I was told it happens a lot too. I was sleep when we first pulled in but I heard the chimes saying we were arriving at the station and that woke me up. A second later the train stopped short and they announced that they'd hit a person who jumped onto the tracks. On the platform, train workers were putting on special plastic uniform things and then ran out onto the track. It was then that I looked out the window and toward the front of the train that I saw the young woman (whose body/clothes looked to be no older than that of a 30 year old) laying face down. All of the people on the platform opposite us had an even clearer view of the atrocity. I'd heard about folks committing suicide on the trains lines before and have even been on some trains that have been stopped because of the jumpers but never have I seen one fall or the reaction of the people around the scene. What appaulled me more than the fact that she jumped was the people laughing and pushing to try to get a glimpse of her. The train workers were trying to get people to pull down the shades on their windows but they wouldn't do it. Then worse of all I saw a teenage girl taking a photo of the body on her cell phone. Un-fucking-believable.

Question#4: When you have a Japanese English teacher, is a foreign English teacher more important than making sure students temperatures dont reach levels where they are passing out at 9am? Couldn't the salary they pay me foot the bill for some fans at least?

Let me describe for you my day at the gynecologist in Japan. This post is not for the squeamish. Today I finally got up the nerve to go get my bi-annual female examination. Not that I was worried that anything was wrong medically, I'd just heard so many horror stories about the Japanese Gynecologist. And today proved they were all true. Usually when I go in for my examination I get all the tests done: Pap Smear, STD (general), HIV, and pregnancy. Today, I asked for the same tests. I don't know these terms in Japanese so I couldn't explain it to the nurse. She had to call the doctor to help me fill out my forms. I get called back to speak with the doctor who is about a million and half years old. No, I mean literally a million. This guy was so old (How old was he?) He was so old...I think he helped deliver Jesus. Dr. Park's is what he calls himself. He lived in America over 30 years ago he said, but isn't as good as English as he was back then (yeah think?!). So, I start telling him the tests I want: first I say Pap Smear. He writes it down and says okay. Next I say HIV. He looks up and me and cringes simultaneously. Then asks "Do you have any symptoms?" I say "No, but I like to get test regularly." He looks at me with a "Yeah, right" expression and writes it down. Then I said I wanted the general STD culture done. He cringes again, taking a little longer to look up at me and starts asking me if I have all these different types of discharge and spots and shit and I'm like "No, these are just test to make sure I don't have anything and am asymptomatic!" Another "yeah right" expression and he rights it down. He orders the nurses around and then tells me to go into this room and take my bottom clothes off. I go into this room where there is stirrups chair but when there is a curtain in front of the seat so that when I sit down I can't see him, the nurses, nothing. And they have me hiked up so damn high in the chair I felt the blood rushing to my head. I asked them to open the curtain but he goes into this long story about customs in Japan that I was SOOO not interested in. Bottom line: He didn't open it. This dude didn't use any lubrication, just shoved his damn instruments and hands whereever, didn't tell me what he was doing or when he was going to do something different, just kept digging and shit. NOT FUN! Then all of a sudden, he goes "Are you married?" At this point I get scared. Dude has been poking and mess for like 10 minutes and busts out with "Are you married?" What would YOU be thinking? I tell him I'm not and he rips back the curtain to show me an ultrasound screen. He explains that I'm not pregnant and I have a healthy uterus then gives me a photo taken from the ultrasound screen. Now, I've heard of urine tests for pregnancy, but this was my first ultrasound. Kinda strange I thought at first, but what a way to know for sure. Even less of a chance for error than the urine test so that's comforting. He finishes up and tells me to get dressed. They take my blood pressure and then the blood sample with that terribly long hateful syringe and I'm done. I'll go back on Friday to get results from the first set of tests and the HIV next week. I never hated the gynecologist before but I do now. Hopefully I'll be in the US the next time I need an exam. Men just don't even realize how uncomfortable and unnerving it is to have a random man "down there". My doctors have always made it a point to make me feel comfortable, but that's not the "Japanese Way" I assume. I'd always choose making sure I'm healthy over my comfort level, but it still sucks to feel the way I did today. Now I see why Japanese women wait until they are about 25 to get their first gyneological exam. NOT an exaggeration!!! Ja ne...

My friend G got married May 30th. He sent me urlLink photos from the wedding. They are just georgous. It looks like it was a very nice day and he and his bride look very happy. Its an interesting emotion seeing someone you used to date get married. The biggest thing I feel though is happiness because I feel that G has been ready and waiting on that someone who was also ready. Then along came "The One" and the rest is history. It's so cool when it works out that way. That's the way it should happen. But what about those of us who its not so easy for? What about when "The One" comes along and both of you realize it, so you run from it. For personally selfish reasons you aren't ready to commit but can't help but feeling bitten by "The Love Bug". You are bitten. There is no doubt about it and soon your body starts to react to the bite. It is slowly being infected by its love serum. The more you try to ignore its power, the harder it becomes to function normally. But still personal desires keep you from completely submitting to the power of love. So you wait and you suffer. Doesn't that version just suck. Congratulations G and T. I wish you all the happiness that true love can bring and more. May your union be blessed with trials and celebrations so that you may appreciate the companion you have been given and may you always remember that your partner is your special gift. Treasure each other like no other thing you've ever been given because this one is extra special. Ja...
